argument.name: data
argument.description: An object with the values in the List that you want to set.

argument.name: options
argument.description: An object with optional settings. The options object can contain these properties:

property.name: setFocusToTargetRow
property.description: true/false - If true, then focus will be given to the target row. The default for this property is false.

property.name: insertRow
property.description: true/false -- Default false. Set to true if you want to insert at a specified position in the List rather than at the end. (Requires build 4444 or above)

property.name: insertPosition
property.description: If options.insertRow is true, specify where in the List the new row should be inserted. options.insertPosition can either be a number or a string. If it is a number, it represents a zero based row number in the List where the new record will be inserted. If it is a string it represents the List value where the new row will be inserted.

page.description: Adds a row of data to a List with a Detail View.

discussion.p: Adds a new row of data to a List that has a Detail View. By default, the new row is added at the end of the List, but you can add the new row (i.e. insert the row) at any position by setting options.

description.p: Contrast the *[js:.addTableRow()]* method with the List object's *[js:.appendRows()]* method.

The *[js:.addTableRow()]* method is the programmatic equivalent of the user entering some values into the List Detail view controls and then clicking on the Save button to save their changes back to the List. When the user does this, the List becomes dirty and the edits that have been made to the list can be synchronized with the server.

The *[js:.appendRows()]* method is a low level method that adds the data to the List, but this method does not add the necessary information to the List to cause the List row that was added to become dirty. The new row *[cannot]* be synchronized with the server.

section.note: To programmatically update a table row see the *[js:.updateTableRow()]* method.

section.title: Adding Multiple Rows to a Table for Lists Persisted to the File System

description.p: You can use the *[js:addTableRow()]* method in a loop to add many new rows to a List quite quickly. Under certain circumstances, however, this can cause a problem.
The circumstances under which this could cause a problem are:

step.description: The List is set to persist to storage (so that the application can function offline)
The *[link:List storage@ux list properties persist where]* is set to 'FileSystem'
The App is running in PhoneGap.

description.p: The reason that there is a potential problem under the above scenario is that writing to the File System in PhoneGap is an asynchronous operation. Each time the List is updated, the edits to the List are saved in files written to the File System. But since these write operations are asynchronous, it is possible (actually likely), that the write operation for the next record added to the List will be initiated before the write operation for the current record added to the List has completed, and so on. These overlapping write operations to the File System could corrupt the files used to store the List edits.

There are two ways to address this issue. One way is to use the [addTableRowsBulk()] method. Another approach is to [temporarily suspend persisting the List] while calling the *[js:addTableRow()]* method in a loop.

section.title: Temporarily Suspending List Persistence in a Loop
section.note: Using the .addTableRowsBulk() method ([described below]) is faster than calling the .addTableRow() method in a loop.

description.p: If you want to write your own loop to add the rows, you can temporarily suspend persisting the List while the *[js:addTableRow()]* method is being called in a loop. Once the loop has completed, turn the suspension off and persist the List to storage.
To suspend persisting to the List, you set the List's *[js:.suspendPersist]* property to true.
To turn persisting back on, you set the List's *[js:.suspendPersist]* to false

To manually persist the List after you have turned suspend persist off use the List's *[link:persistToStorage() method@list object persisttostorage method]*. You must pass in an empty object when calling this method.

section.title: Adding Multiple List Rows using addTableRowsBulk()

description.p: The *[js:addTableRowsBulk()]* method can be used to add multiple rows to a List quickly. Using the .addTableRowsBulk() method is faster than calling the .addTableRow() method in a loop. To use this method, create a JSON array of rows to add to the List control.
